edge: MOVIES have DETAILS associated with them.
Each MOVIE has a SUMMARY that is part of its DETAILS.
Baywatch is a 2017 American action comedy film directed by Seth Gordon, with Mitch Buchannon as the lead character in this movie based on the television series of the same name.
Mitch Buchannon is a beloved member of an elite lifeguard division known as Baywatch, which protects the beaches and the bay.
Stephanie Holden is a part of the elite lifeguard division known as Baywatch, which includes Mitch Buchannon and veteran C. J. Parker.
Veteran C. J. Parker is a part of the elite lifeguard division known as Baywatch, which includes Mitch Buchannon and Stephanie Holden.
Jealous beat cop Garner Ellerbee is opposed to the elite lifeguard division known as Baywatch.
Captain Thorpe is the superior of the elite lifeguard division known as Baywatch, which includes Mitch Buchannon and Stephanie Holden.
In Emerald Bay, Florida, Lt. Mitch Buchannon finds a small pouch of flakka near the Huntley Club owned by powerful businesswoman Victoria Leeds.
Later, Mitch meets Matt Brody, who is his colleague in this movie.
The context involves a scene where Mitch is on patrol and he meets Matt Brody, who later joins the Baywatch team.
Mitch finds a small pouch of flakka near the Huntley Club, owned by Victoria Leeds.
The context suggests that drugs are being retrieved from barrels of fish at the Huntley Club owned by Victoria Leeds.
Mitch and his team continue to investigate Rodriguez's murder.
Another dead body is found on the beach.
Mitch and his team hide and take a video of Leeds' henchmen planting an autopsy report to cover up Rodriguez's murder, but are discovered and the recording is destroyed.
The context suggests that drugs are being retrieved from barrels of fish at the Huntley Club owned by Victoria Leeds.
Mitch and Brody compete in a variety of physical tests, which Mitch wins. As the course is ending, a mom and her two kids fall into the water and the lifeguards and Brody rush to save them.
Mitch meets Matt Brody, an entitled Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer who expects to make the Baywatch team without trying out.
The context involves a scene where Mitch finds a small pouch of flakka near the Huntley Club, owned by Victoria Leeds.
Thorpe fires Mitch, naming Brody the new lieutenant.
Brody later sees 'sand grifters (beach thieves)' steal bags using a cooler. He orders them off the beach.
Enraged that Mitch deserted his post, Thorpe fires him.
Orders them off the beach after witnessing their theft using a cooler.
Finds it on the beach and uses a cooler to steal the second victim's report from Ellerbee's desk.
Confirms that the man was killed by knife instead of a shark attack after receiving it from Brody.
Recognizes him as his friend and realizes that Mitch was right about the Huntley after seeing him working for Ellerbee.
Uses the hull to smuggle drugs and bribes Thorpe to replace Mitch with Brody before pushing him into a bait cage.
Gloats about her plan to privatize the entire beach after capturing Brody and pushing him into a bait cage.
Swims to him and gives him mouth-to-mouth resuscitation after he hallucinates that she is Mitch. However, Brody realizes that it's a hallucination.
Catches up to her before she can escape on a helicopter after discovering that she's been using the hull to smuggle drugs.
Punches him in the face and gets him arrested for his role in Leeds' plan after he berates Mitch for returning to the beach.
Takes them into custody after they capture Brody.
Dies shortly after as a result of Thorpe's actions.

announced in 2004 but stuck in development hell over the years with several writers penning drafts. In October 2014, Dwayne Johnson was attached to star in the lead role and Justin Malen was set to rewrite the script.
replaced Sean Anders as director in July 2015
wrote the latest draft, and the film would be comedic in style.
joined to produce with Johnson's Seven Bucks Productions on August 10, 2015
short list testing for the lead female role as of November 9, 2015
cast as C. J. Parker on January 4, 2016
Kelly Rohrbach's casting as C. J. Parker was confirmed by Johnson's Instagram post.
Johnson's partner Dany Garcia, through their Seven Bucks Productions,
Damian Shannon and Mark Swift wrote the screenplay,
On January 20, 2016, Johnson again posted on his Instagram about casting Ilfenesh Hadera as Johnson's love interest.
Bass was cast in the film to play Ronnie, a funny, awkward, and skilled disco dancer at the beach,
On February 12, 2016, Hannibal Buress joined the cast of the film to play a bay community local.
On February 17, 2016, Priyanka Chopra signed on to star as the antagonist in the film.
In March 2016, Yahya Abdul-Mateen II joined the cast as Ellerbee, a police officer who is constantly reminding Mitch that being a lifeguard, he has no actual jurisdiction on the beach.
Principal photography on the film Baywatch began in Deerfield Beach, Florida.
The film was shot in Miami.
The film was shot in Savannah, Georgia.
In January 2016, Paramount Pictures scheduled Baywatch for a May 19, 2017 release, which was originally scheduled for a sequel to Terminator Genisys.
In December 2016, Paramount pushed the release date back one week to May 26, 2017, to avoid competition with Alien: Covenant.

node_2: pirates of the caribbean: dead men tell no tales
edge: In April 2017, the film was moved one day earlier, to avoid direct competition with Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales.
Baywatch was released on Digital HD on August 15, 2017.
Baywatch was released on Blu-ray and DVD on August 29, 2017.
receives largely unfavorable reviews from, with an average score of 37 out of 100 on Metacritic and a Rotten Tomatoes rating of 17% based on 246 reviews.
gave the film an average grade of 'B+' on an A+ to F scale according to CinemaScore, while PostTrak reported overall positive score of 76%.
responded to critics' reviews by saying that the film was made for fans.
according to Richard Roeper from Chicago Sun-Times, who compared it to other poorly received adaptations of television shows in his review
according to Owen Gleiberman from Variety, who called it 'stupidly entertaining... for a while'
Dwayne Johnson responded to critics' reviews in relation to the film's reception
Dwayne Johnson also mentioned fans' love for the film while responding to critics' reviews
Peter Travers' critical review of Baywatch, which focused on the 'easy rapport' between the lead actors
Brian Truitt's review of Baywatch, where he stated that the film yearned to be both a sendup farce and a straight action film
In May 2017, producer Beau Flynn revealed plans for a sequel were in development.
The plot would revolve around the titular team's adventures overseas.
Damian Shannon and Mark Swift were stated to be returning to their roles as co-screenwriters,
Dwayne Johnson entered early negotiations to reprise his role,
Zac Efron entered early negotiations to reprise his role,
while the remaining cast were expected to also return in the potential sequel.
